definition: abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: We see Yu Xianyang Lao Jia command, it will not allow unauthorized action.
sentences.chinese: 命令賈老道務必看住俞顯揚，絕不允許其私自行動。

sentences.english: Our Fatheer , who art in heaven , hallowed be thy name .
sentences.chinese: 我們的天父，願你的名受顯揚。

sentences.english: I ask you to bring to light the importance of God's desire of consecration.
sentences.chinese: 我要求你，把天主重視這奉獻的渴望顯揚出來。

sentences.english: Jingyuan then asked Yu Xianyang to open handcuffs shackles, Pelle had to do.
sentences.chinese: 靜遠隨即要求打開俞顯揚的手銬腳鐐，小秋只得照辦。

sentences.english: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.
sentences.chinese: 凡受造之物都熱切地等待天主子女的顯揚。

sentences.english: What is a man that thou shouldst magnify him? or why dost thou set thy heart upon him?
sentences.chinese: 人算什麼，你竟如此顯揚他，將他置諸心頭。

sentences.english: Yu Xianyang turned and waved fists will be agile, a Japanese doctor.
sentences.chinese: 俞顯揚身手敏捷，轉身揮動拳腳將日本醫生擺平。

sentences.english: Kotoko let Yu Xianyang rushed to their hostage, forcing the Japanese soldiers out of the way.
sentences.chinese: 琴子見狀便讓俞顯揚以自己爲人質，迫使日兵讓路。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
displaying fully/developing to the greatest extent
work or plans left as a legacy/the views of the departed/posthumous orders or teachings
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
